info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 10:19PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTH CENTRAL WESTMORELAND...NORTHEASTERN GREENE AND WESTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM EDT... At 1019 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fairdale, or 11 miles east of Waynesburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Uniontown, Connellsville, California, Scottdale, Masontown, Bentleyville, Brownsville, Fredericktown-Millsboro, South Connellsville, Perryopolis, Fairdale, and Jefferson Boro. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 36 and 39. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 8 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for southwestern Pennsylvania.
